value.description:
A large, distinctive-looking tree with a unique life-cycle, warm, skin-smooth bark and long iridescent leaves. Infused with bioluminescent micro-organisms, anima trees develop a unique form of psychic symbiosis with surrounding lifeforms. Each Anima Nexus tree contains a small non-conscious dryad queen. The queen births creatures called dryads which guard and tend the tree. In exchange, the tree nurtures its protectors by feeding them directly. From the outside, it appears the dryads are created by the tree directly and act as part of it.

It is possible for a person to form a connection with a tree and partially control the dryads it produces.

Some say Anima Nexus trees are the homes of nature spirits that follow humanity across worlds. Tribal psycasters are also able to draw psyfocus from anima trees while meditating to them.

Anima trees' psychic properties are weakened if artificial structures are placed nearby. They refuse to be caged or studied, and must remain part of nature.
Symbiotic bush infused with luminous microorganisms, often found growing around Anima Nexus trees.
A small pod that protects a single Anima seed. This seed can be harvested and used to plant an Anima Nexus tree.
The seed of an Anima Nexus tree. It can be planted to create a new Anima Nexus tree.

Dryads are small mammalian creatures that have a symbiotic relationship with the Anima Nexus trees. This immature dryad can support and protect its tree, but its main purpose is to morph into more specialized and powerful dryad forms.

A slow, bumbling caste of dryad which specializes in wood production. Together with its Anima Nexus tree, this dryad can generate a wood-like material on an ongoing basis. However, it is slow and ineffective at work or combat.\n\nIn general, dryads are mammal-like creatures that have a symbiotic relationship with the Anima Nexus trees. They reproduce together with their tree, which contains a hidden dryad queen. Dryads can morph into various specialized castes.

A dryad caste specialized in food production. Together with its Anima Nexus tree, this dryad can generate nourishing berries on an ongoing basis. However, it is slow and ineffective at work or combat.\n\nIn general, dryads are mammal-like creatures that have a symbiotic relationship with the Anima Nexus trees. They reproduce together with their tree, which contains a hidden dryad queen. Dryads can morph into various specialized castes.

A dryad caste specialized in medicine production. Together with its Anima Nexus tree, this dryad can generate medicinal herbs on an ongoing basis. However, it is slow and ineffective at work or combat.\n\nIn general, dryads are mammal-like creatures that have a symbiotic relationship with the Anima Nexus trees. They reproduce together with their tree, which contains a hidden dryad queen. Dryads can morph into various specialized castes.

A dryad caste with the unique ability to produce new Anima seed pods and reproduce the Anima Nexus tree along with its symbiote, the dryad queen. To do this, three seedmaker dryads must slowly merge.\n\nIn general, dryads are mammal-like creatures that have a symbiotic relationship with the Anima Nexus trees. They reproduce together with their tree, which contains a hidden dryad queen. Dryads can morph into various specialized castes.

A dryad caste specialized in carrying items. Under human influence, it can help haul things where they need to go.\n\nIn general, dryads are mammal-like creatures that have a symbiotic relationship with the Anima Nexus trees. They reproduce together with their tree, which contains a hidden dryad queen. Dryads can morph into various specialized castes.

A dryad caste with huge claws that is specialized in aggression and damage-dealing attacks. Though it can do tremendous damage, it is vulnerable to attacks itself.\n\nIn general, dryads are mammal-like creatures that have a symbiotic relationship with the Anima Nexus trees. They reproduce together with their tree, which contains a hidden dryad queen. Dryads can morph into various specialized castes.

A dryad caste specialized in absorbing hits during combat. Barkskin dryads are covered by a thick bark-like hide which is partly formed by the Anima tree itself. Under human influence, it can act as a damage-absorbing fighter.\n\nIn general, dryads are mammal-like creatures that have a symbiotic relationship with the Anima Nexus trees. They reproduce together with their tree, which contains a hidden dryad queen. Dryads can morph into various specialized castes.

A sphere of fibrous plant matter. A dryad inside is slowly morphing into a new form. Anima Nexus trees grow these spheres to help protect the dryads as they morph.

The result of the merging of several Seedmaker dryads, this symbiotic plant/animal pod is an essential part of the Anima Nexus life cycle. After some time, it will flower into a mature Anima Nexus pod which can be harvested to plant a new Anima Nexus tree.
